reason.raw: observed unusual ogre terrain lod behavior with certain heightmap sizes. Need to investigate further.
reason.html: observed unusual ogre terrain lod behavior with certain heightmap sizes. Need to investigate further.

description.raw:
* ~~~changed subsampling level to 1 (no interpolation between vertices). This was set to 2 in pull request #493 probably for the terrain editor. At a value=2, we ended up with 4x the number of triangles in  the heightmap mesh~~~

* added option to enable level of details (LOD). This is mainly for the client side as we don't want LOD to change on server side which will cause mismatch between heightmap visual and collision.

 To see LOD in effect, add this option to the `gui.ini` file:

~~~
[heightmap]
lod=3
~~~

[Here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/0b6uqlr6s3yjvv7/red_dem.zip?dl=0)'s a zip file of a large dem model to test with. Switch to wireframe mode and slowly rotate the camera to look at the terrain from a top down view to a 45 degree angle. The heightmap mesh should become coarser as the camera angle gets perpendicular to the heightmap normal.
description.html:
• ~changed subsampling level to 1 (no interpolation between vertices). This was set to 2 in pull request #493 probably for the terrain editor. At a value=2, we ended up with 4x the number of triangles in the heightmap mesh~

  • added option to enable level of details (LOD). This is mainly for the client side as we don't want LOD to change on server side which will cause mismatch between heightmap visual and collision.

To see LOD in effect, add this option to the gui.ini file:

[heightmap]
lod=3

Here's a zip file of a large dem model to test with. Switch to wireframe mode and slowly rotate the camera to look at the terrain from a top down view to a 45 degree angle. The heightmap mesh should become coarser as the camera angle gets perpendicular to the heightmap normal.

title: Improve heightmap rendering performance: LOD

summary.raw:
* ~~~changed subsampling level to 1 (no interpolation between vertices). This was set to 2 in pull request #493 probably for the terrain editor. At a value=2, we ended up with 4x the number of triangles in  the heightmap mesh~~~

* added option to enable level of details (LOD). This is mainly for the client side as we don't want LOD to change on server side which will cause mismatch between heightmap visual and collision.

 To see LOD in effect, add this option to the `gui.ini` file:

~~~
[heightmap]
lod=3
~~~

[Here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/0b6uqlr6s3yjvv7/red_dem.zip?dl=0)'s a zip file of a large dem model to test with. Switch to wireframe mode and slowly rotate the camera to look at the terrain from a top down view to a 45 degree angle. The heightmap mesh should become coarser as the camera angle gets perpendicular to the heightmap normal.
summary.html:
• ~changed subsampling level to 1 (no interpolation between vertices). This was set to 2 in pull request #493 probably for the terrain editor. At a value=2, we ended up with 4x the number of triangles in the heightmap mesh~

  • added option to enable level of details (LOD). This is mainly for the client side as we don't want LOD to change on server side which will cause mismatch between heightmap visual and collision.

To see LOD in effect, add this option to the gui.ini file:

[heightmap]
lod=3

Here's a zip file of a large dem model to test with. Switch to wireframe mode and slowly rotate the camera to look at the terrain from a top down view to a 45 degree angle. The heightmap mesh should become coarser as the camera angle gets perpendicular to the heightmap normal.

reason: observed unusual ogre terrain lod behavior with certain heightmap sizes. Need to investigate further.
